48    /**
49    * Basic Hibernate helper class for Hibernate config and startup.
50    * <p>
51    * Uses a static initializer to read startup options and initialize
52    * <tt>Configuration</tt> and <tt>SessionFactory</tt>.
53    * <p>
54    * This class also tries to figure out if JNDI binding of the
55    * <tt>SessionFactory</tt> is used, otherwise it falls back to a global static
56    * variable (Singleton). If you use this helper class to obtain a
57    * <tt>SessionFactory</tt> in your code, you are shielded from these deployment
58    * differences.
59    * <p>
60    * Another advantage of this class is access to the <tt>Configuration</tt>
61    * object that was used to build the current <tt>SessionFactory</tt>. You can
62    * access mapping metadata programmatically with this API, and even change it
63    * and rebuild the <tt>SessionFactory</tt>.
64    * <p>
65    * Note: This class supports annotations if you replace the line that creates a
66    * Configuration object.
67    * <p>
68    * Note: This class supports only one data store. Support for several
69    * <tt>SessionFactory</tt> instances can be easily added (through a static
70    * <tt>Map</tt>, for example). You could then lookup a <tt>SessionFactory</tt>
71    * by its name.
72    *
73    * @author Christian Bauer
74    */

221    * {@link AnnotationConfiguration}.
222    * <p>
